item.title: Deep Video Reconstruction From Brain Activity
item.description:
Status: Ongoing (Since Dec 2020)

I am working with Prof. Radoslaw Martin Cichy (Neural Dynamics of Visual Cognition Lab, Freie Universit√§t Berlin) and Prof. Gemma Roig (Computer Vision and Artificial Intelligence Lab, Goethe University) to decode and reconstruct the features of natural videos from brain fMRI signals using Deep Learning. We are using Deep Neural Network activations as a proxy to map the fMRI features to the video space to decode, understand and compare the hierarchical and selective representation of features in the brain and neural network using activation maximization.

item.title: Intervertebral Disc Segmentation using U-Net
item.description:
Status: Completed (May 2020 - Jul 2020)

This project was completed as my summer internship at Laboratory for Orthopaedic Biomechanics, ETH Zurich, under the guidance of Dr. Jonas Widmer. The project involved building an image segmentation component of a larger pipeline for automatic analysis of spine MRI to indentify spinal defects. I was involved in segmentation of intervertebral disc. I compared different variants of U-Net (viz. vanilla, skip connection, inception modules etc). The model achieved a dice score of 94.1% and the overall segmentation pipeline scored 91.8%, which is competent with the state-of-the-art apporoaches.
